p: Dengue virus (genus Flavivirus, family Flaviviridae) includes four serotypes (DENV-1 to DENV-4). It is the most widespread arbovirus in the world and is reported in over 100 countries [ 76]. Aedes aegypti and Ae. albopictus are the main vectors of DENV acting in urban cycles. According to the latest ECDC annual epidemiological report, covering the 2012â€“2016 period, 1562 cases (Switzerland excluded) were reported in our study area [ 74]. The first autochthonous cases of dengue fever were reported in our area of interest (France) in 2010 [ 77]. Other outbreaks in 2013 and 2015 also occurred in Southern France [ 5, 78], where Ae. albopictus is well established and found in abundance [ 7].
